content:
I noticed that when I access a vanilla install of Backdrop, there are two session cookies and a google analytics cookie:
[_ga] => GA1.2.877217365.1601902998
Is this from one of the CDNs we use, or just to track Backdrop usage statistics?
They were only set for a logged in user.
Thanks for any information, I appreciate it.
Two session cookies are normal, but for sure Backdrop core adds no google analytics cookies. Which modules do you have installed?

no contrib modules at all.
I'm perplexed. :neutral:
Thank you, I appreciate the info.

Maybe you can figure out more if you delete all cookies (flush all browser cache, too) and log in again?

Another thought - do you have a custom theme? Or is that vanilla core, too?
Very odd :thinking: ...Backdrop is definitely not adding any GA cookies.
This might be a long shot, but what about the hosting environment?
And yet another thought... Is that Backdrop site on a subdomain?

@indigoxela yes
Let me check a few things on the server and on my google analytics account and I'll update this thread

Im using Firefox Developer edition and when I deleted the cookie in question it dissappeared everywhere it was showing up (two different domains)
This is still perplexing, but it does not seem to be a Backdrop issue. Thanks, all.
